description: Great Starbucks! Liked the service, went in the afternoon to avoid rush hour. The supervisor, Ray, at the location does a great job at managing his team and store. Always very welcoming, extroverted, and approachable. The manager, Cynthia also does a great job at servicing customers whenever a customer has a complaint. The employees are great! Quick to make drinks and always servicing customers when drinks made wrong. Highly recommend!
author: Dayana H.

description:
So I guess starbucks is, what starbucks is. Found this location, ordered ahead, extra whip saw him make it since he didnt pull tag until I was there... no hi, no look up, no nothing. This guy looked like he wanted to be anywhere but there. No whip, and no answer when I saw him not do it, and asked him...
Disappointing that looking forward to the happy San Fran people 
NOT
author: Mel H.

description:
This Starbucks is in a fantastic location. I spent the day in the Polk Gulch, and I hopped over to study at this location after enjoying lunch nearby. Although I didn't have the chance to sit there, I enjoyed the window seating this location provides. Great for sipping on coffee and doing some people watching. 

I just ordered a medium roast coffee, but it looks like Starbucks has increased their selection recently. There were salads and sandwiches at this location, along with additional water and juices. The coffee was on point, but the customer service left more to be desired. Won't stop me from considering this spot again for weekend adventures. 

Overall a good spot, but I'd also recommend Philz right down the street.
author: Nicholas G.

description: This is a comment that I hope everyone working cafes in San Francisco reads. As a female that is much smaller than average (and perhaps violent) male homeless person on who knows what drugs, it is not okay for you as a staff person to let those people into the cafe and endanger all of our lives. You manage the store and you need to make sure it's a place where all of us paying customers feel safe. This time was just a homeless man cursing at me and giving me the finger but will he be even more angry next time and push me or harm me even further? That's not an event I want for my well being and it's not a liability you should want in your stores either.
author: Kate B.

description:
After dinner nearby, I came here for a mocha to go. It was 7:50pm and got in right before the store's closing.  This location is actually pretty large with many tables for customers.  There was only one person in line and I was able to place my order. Having worked retail, I know getting a rush of customers before closing is a worker's worst fear.  The clerk was friendly in processing my order. He also made my mocha as well. 

After reading fellow Yelpers comments about rudeness, I guess I was fortunate to have had a good experience.  Maybe I came at the right time of day.
author: Al L.

description: So impressed with this Starbucks.  Clean floors, countertops and lush fireplace.   Two Large L shape sofas with plenty of seating.  Hip Russian Hill neighborhood with a lot going on.  No bums or panhandling.  Up there with the finest Starbucks I have enjoyed.
author: Gavin M.

description:
My family have lived on this area for ..30 years,
Coffee and services was good as Starbucks suppose to be.
But my Warning is just don't buy their sandwiches
It was 3 days old and bad.
You don't need a longer review.
author: Nasu N.

description: Just wondering why some lady gets to cut in front of me and get her Oder taken first. Entitled folks being catered to by lame employees talking about the weather.
author: Werd R.

description:
Starbucks has low standards for coffee.  You really can't call that stuff coffee because it's so watered down & tasteless!  Giving one star is extremely generous!!

Was excited for the pumpkin spice latte today, the the excitement quickly diminished when I took a sip.  I don't normally set foot in any Starbucks but wanted a seasonal drink.

Just ewww...
author: G W.

description:
Came in the afternoon today and the place was empty. Yet it took almost 5 min to get my cold brew( very easy drink to make)
The place was being run by two punk kids, one female one male
They both looked miserable, they were mopping instead of making my drink
THen when she asked for help he pouted and did help but it was half ass and he was too lazy to reach to the back of the fridge to get the vanilla sweet cream so he put half and half and pumped vanilla syrup


Worst Starbucks I've ever been to
author: John C.

description:
I've been coming to this Starbucks for a couple of months now as it's close to work.

I used to think some of the employees were only rude to me, but after reading all these reviews I realize they are rude to everyone.

Seriously if you don't want to deal with customers than probably don't work at a place like this.

Sucks because I really love getting drinks here and it's the closest Starbucks to my job but they give such a bad vibe that I hate coming in here.
author: Sandra C.

description: One of the slowest and most disorganized Starbucks I've ever been to.  The mobile orders take at least 10 mins and there is hardly any in there. Half the time you have to remind them you had a mobile order.
author: Courtney O.

description: Typical, albeit it reasonably well-run Starbucks.  Seems like it was re-done relatively recently and the seating options are pretty nice - I like the booths/banquets the best.  No complaints.
author: Jeff A.

description:
You can't accept a $50 bill?

Petes coffee two doors down did. 

And they'll be getting them from now on.
author: Jeff W.

description: This has to be the best Starbucks that I have ever been in, to all there staff, what a great team, that's what's makes a great business, team work
author: D S.

description:
Horrible.   I bought a donut and a scone.  I used my Starbucks card on my phone.  Later I noticed they had charged me $20 instead of the regular price.  I called and the manager said to stop by anytime this week and she would take care of it.  When I stopped by today the supervisor on duty told me without a receipt there is nothing she can do.  
So I was ripped off by Starbucks.  And then told to come by.  Then told there was nothing they could do. 
Wow.  
Never go there!!!
author: kathleen h.

description: Rude order taker.  Showed impatience towards tourist.    Considering they went through training  recently.
author: Choy M.

description: Rude staff. I don't like to post negative things, but the customer is paying and deserve attention and consideration.
author: Marcelo B.

description:
The corner Starbuck's in Russian Hill has been remodeled.

"Like, I give a shit!"

The iconic frozen frappuccino is celebrating its 20th anniversary. For a limited time, the coffee chain has made a special frappe drink to mark its anniversary; "The Happy Birthday Frappuccino!"

For $3.95, I get a mixture of Vanilla Bean Frappe with a splash of hazelnut syrup and a raspberry flavored whipped cream topping in a 20oz cup ("grande" in Starbuck's size terms).  The way the frozen drink looks is like a birthday cake. But the drink was just too sweet for my liking. 

The special frozen drink is just available until the end of March. But I am sure some Starbuck's locations will still make the celebratory frozen beverage. 

For me, I just wanted that one and only time and that is it!
author: Matt G.

description: Rude old white man cashier named Michael. If you're gonna yell at people to hurry up because your line of 3 ppl is piling up, maybe you should reevaluate working at a Starbucks at 6am?? God forbid you might have PAYING customers buying coffee at this hour! So much for hospitality. Steve was very nice. Zero stars for rude cashier.
author: Jasmyne W.

description: Great location, use the app ahead of time. Always crowded on the weekend and before work.
author: Barron C.

description: Gold Member, Come here often. Waited in line to order my drink before I tried to use the restroom. As I got my drink the rude associate (Marisol). Told me I wouldn't be allowed to use the restroom and the group in front of me would be allowed to go. I explained I wanted to be a good patron and order ahead before I waited in a long restroom line. Horrible experience. So much bad energy. I honestly felt discriminated against.
author: Victor-Hugo W.

description: This Starbucks has the worst service of any I've been to (and I've been to a few). Three weeks in a row it's taken 15 mins to get a latte. If you order from the app, they don't read out the names so you have to pick up every coffee that comes out, read the label and awkwardly put it back for the next person to do the same thing. If you order at the register, the woman is utterly rude (during my last visit I started to order, she cut me off, raised her hand and said "WAIT". could have just politely told me she was finishing something off). Worth the extra drive to one of the other Starbucks around.
author: Genevieve T.

description: Very rude staff, don't complain when your order is wrong...they tell you it's your fault.
author: K F.

description: Unfriendly, rude employees, had couple of bad experieneces. Probably worst starbucks in SF
author: Guler Y.

description: Great location and inside -- plenty of room to sit. I come here pretty often to work. The only downside is the employees have an unfriendly attitude about them.
author: Amit R.

description: I've walked out twice - service is incredibly slow. Everyone looks confused behind the counter. Good thing there's a Peet's next door.
author: Cameron T.

description: This Starbucks just got worst. Service is always slow but service just got super bad. It's close to me therefore I come here but really need to make some changes for this location. Rude, not friendly and slow. I miss the old staff they had.
author: Sandy B.

description: The staff is not terribly friendly but their music is bomb. T. Rex, New Order, Garbage, Bowie. It's such a nice change from that indie folk put me to sleep stuff or some muzak nonsense.
author: Reena R.

description:
I love this Starbucks. They're efficient and always friendly to me, even when they're having a rough day. Connie  and Lyn are two of the nicest baristas I've ever met, and always are courteous and polite. I think people like to give this location a hard time because they don't understand that the world doesn't revolve around them. 

My favorite starbs to get coffee in the morning!!
author: Jasper-Mikhael R.

description:
This Starbucks is the worst. I only frequent it because I do like their drinks, it's close to work and have had several gift cards recently.  The manager, Michael is very unfriendly and makes you feel stupid when you order anything.  One day I ordered a drink, said the size and he yelled at me saying "I need to know what size!" Dude, I just told you. Most of the other baristas are okay, but just so incredibly slow. Your drink is always lukewarm at best and more that often, incorrect.

I hate to write this review as I have worked At Starbucks and understand the pressures and stress, but my hope is they at least work on their customer service, you can always microwave your drink.
author: Georgia T.

description:
I come here often as I love Starbucks in general and it is close to my house. As long as you are not in ANY SORT of rush it is a fine place and you will eventually receive your Starbucks drink. The atmosphere is the typical Starbucks coffee shop and nice to do work or study in. However, the service is slower than slow. Example; Today I waited 8 minutes at the counter for a mobile order that was placed 7 minutes prior to arriving! Mobile orders are often placed because one is in a rush, well that is my experience anyway. When I asked about the order the female barista was very rude and snotty about the fact that she was currently making it. 

The sugar, napkins, and milks are more often then not empty and the trash is always over flowing to a ridiculous point especially because there is a chair and counter right next the trash and it makes it uncomfortable to sit in that spot.
author: Julia L.

description:
A Starbucks review. How exciting. Let's keep it short.

Nice: 
- layout
- window front seating 
- outdoor seating (on Polk)
- fireplace

Not so nice:
- seats usually taken by 6.30am
author: Sebastian F.

description: Worst Starbucks ever. Incredibly condescending. Make drinks wrong frequently and then are dicks about it.
author: Jimmy B.

description: This branch is very bad service. I would like to complain this branch because your employees. They talked with me very impolite despite I tell them extreamly polite. I dunno why ? because Im an Asian guy or what ? I want to tell your employees that if u chooes to work about service, u have to be glad when u service the customers. I never complain any cafes or restaurents before, but I've complained u for the first.
author: Tharnupetch L.

description: First time at this location. I ordered a clover coffee Ethiopian Yirgacheffe for $4.  I overheard The barista later told the lady who took my order that they ran out of the coffee I ordered. It's ok that they ran out, it happens. The barista made me another coffee which he says is equally good, cost $3. I had to ask for my $1 refund and he didn't seem to happy about that, to me he felt like it was a hassle. He only gave me back $0.50 and he said the price written on the board suppose to be 3.5 not 4. I didn't care about the money at all but more for the experience which sadly did not deliver. Could be not his day, I get it we all have those days. I guess I can give this place try again. Atmosphere was very clean and inviting though.
author: rod h.

description: Rudest Starbucks I have ever been to... I frequent this area, and usually I have an "ok" experience, but today everyone was just flat rude, and provided horrible customer service
author: Nicky V.

description:
Slow service, but store is spacious. Lots of tables, chairs and outlets. Almost empty at 2PM on a Tuesday. 

Drinks? Well ... you know, pretty standard. 

Cheers :)
author: Mily W.

description:
I ordered a tall latte, when it was time to pick up the latte, felt more like an empty cup. Open the lid to find foam, ok. There's something in there. Barely took a sip n walked a block away, im still steaming from lack of weight. So I opened the lid again and the foam has defoamed compltelty and I found myself holding a half full cup. 
Seruously!! What the heck, I just paid $4+ for this?! 
Never again at this location.
Ill go to the other chain down the street, cheaper too.
author: Christi S.

description:
What is wrong with the manager of this Starbucks location?  First, this location is one of the most disgustingly dirty ones I've seen anywhere in the world, and I've been to locations throughout the US, Europe, Asian and South America.  This one is the worst ... more food, spilled drink, and who knows what else covering the sidewalk just outside of this location than any I've seen anywhere.  Don't they ever clean?!

Second, there is rarely enough food inside.  9 out of 10 times I've gone there in the middle of the day, the food bin that should be filled with pastries is more than 3/4 empty.  Even though they are many hours left in their business day.  Does the manager of this Starbucks location just not want to sell food at all, so that he purposefully doesn't offer any?  Or is he trying so hard to keep his food cost down, that he never bothers to realize they will never profit if they don't actually offer sufficient product that people would want to buy?  Does he really not get that the reason people are not ordering more is because they don't actually offer any to sell?

Frankly, even though this location is very close to where I live, I've taken to walking many other blocks to other locations much further away, as this one is pathetic.  Either he needs to get his team to do some serious cleaning on a regular basis, plus he needs to actually order enough product to sell, or the manager should be fired for incompetence.
author: Chris A.

description: This is the worst Starbucks - the employees are rude, on almost every occasion. It is also so slow - even when they are staffed with 4 employees, getting a coffee is a long wait. This location needs a serious shake up. I've been going to this location for nearly four years and it's become progressively worse. I'm done with this place, I'll go to the Peet's two doors down.
author: Dave G.

description: This Starbucks location needs some help.  I ordered a blueberry oatmeal.  After about 10 minutes of waiting, I walked up to the barista window and they were like, "oh yeah, blueberry oatmeal, we'll make that right now"...so basically they forgot.  Then, they didn't add enough water, so once I added the blueberries and stirred, there was still raw oatmeal in the middle.  They offered to add more water, but that would have cooked the blueberries.  Ended up having to have them remake it.
author: Steve B.

description:
This Starbucks definitely leaves much to be desired. It's too bad I have already built up a routine to come here.

The A/C is always on freezing cold. I asked the barista and she curtly said "we like to keep it cold." No question of comfort for the customers.

Half of the baristas here are also much less friendly than other cafes I have been to. Usually some combination of attitude or curtness.

I am not a frequent yelper with negative reviews, but after dealing with this the last several visits, feel I need to say something online at least. Wish I could talk to the manager at least about the A/C because I don't think I want to come back anymore.
author: Fin D.

description: Avoid when busy. After about 30 minutes of waiting for my drink (there were about 50 people in line or waiting for their coffee) I asked if mine was coming up. It was an iced coffee, without sweetener. So, cold coffee out of the pitcher and ice, into a cup. Apparently they either lost the cup, or someone else picked up my drink. This was after watching a few people who ordered well after me pick up the same drink. The same thing happened to a few other folks as well. I'd rather have no coffee than to wait for a half hour.
author: Chris W.

description: This is a cool Starbucks, good coffee, friendly employees. Came here the other night and they were closed at 8:30, seemed fairly early for a coffee shop (although it was a Wednesday).
author: Timothy C.

description:
A great stop on Polk. Approximately 10 tables. Free wifi. A couple of outdoor tables. 
Coffee and hot teas with light snacks. 
Very comfortable for work environment but it's difficult to get a table at time. It's pretty popular so expect a wait.
author: Marie A.

description:
I was feeling this Starbucks but the employees that I so cherished I haven't seen in a while. Instead I keep seeing the same two girls who must find it painful to smile and a tall guy (joseph or Justin, something like that) that is just flat out rude.

I went in the other day with my friend in the morning just before it got busy. I was taking out my wallet as my friend ordered but since they didn't have what she wanted she didn't get anything. So I ordered, I knew what I wanted but wasn't ready with my cards. So as I fumble to find my credit card, bring up my Starbucks app and find the coupon code, he rolls his eyes, huffs at me n then takes the next guests order. Then throws my sandwich in the bag, cheese everywhere. 

If I hadn't been in a rush, I would've talked to the manager. It's never ok to show a customer that kind of attitude, regardless of a rush or anything else.
author: Shaunda N.

description:
Nice lounge area but the guys working behind the counter couldn't care less about the people. No greeting or thank you. I made the mistake to not ask for a dark or medium roast. I got medium. And asked if it was dark. The guy behind the counter said you didn't ask for dark.  Well guess what you didn't ask which roast I wanted either.  

Tables were dirty and so were the benches.
author: David C.

description: This is the rudest Starbucks that i have ever been to. It is the day before christmas eve and these workers should be in better spirit. They are making the company look bad i will never come back here again
author: Emerald J.

description: They really need to do something about their crew..theiy are not only rude when you walk in after 7 but they also qould kick you out from 7:30 on. we know they close at 8 bit they wil let you know every minute you stay..really rude people!
author: Sergio L.

description: One of the worst Starbucks around. So incredibly slow. Rude customer service. Always out of milk and drink condiments on the shelf and typically dirty in the area. Wish none of this was the case because it's in a great location. This is not based on a single visit but various.
author: Karen Q.

description: Rude staff and terribly slow. I go to a Starbucks a couple times a day but am now going to avoid this one completely even though it's the closest one to my apartment. Sad as it used to be well run but no longer.
author: John P.

description: This place gives off the worse vibes ever! I went in today to get a simple drink. Just a hot tea that's all that's it. The 2 people behind the register made me feel as if I was an inconvenience to them. Ummm aren't you on the clock? Almost everyone who works here acts as if they hate it there just as much as I hate going in. :) it's seriously my last resort when I'm in a rush.
author: Kay B.

description:
Great one.
Only thing Carlos is very unprofessional in his interaction with his coworkers in front of customers!
author: eigil q.

description:
Usually they crank up the Ac--- too cold..
They close the bathroom 1h before closing time, Wtf!!!!
author: Amir S.

description: Just ordered a drink and it was horrible I love Starbucks but the girl with short hair cannot make drinks or maybe she doesn't care. She made my drink wrong and it was all ice so I watched her top off the rest with milk if I wasnt in a rush I would've asked for a new one
author: Lidoshka G.

description: This Starbucks is the slowest I have ever been in in my entire life. The line is always almost out the door on Saturdays yet they never seem to speed up and there's usually only three people working. Get it together please :)
author: Lea W.

description:
Eh, its Starbucks. 

But wait! Not just ANY Starbucks....its the Russian Hill Starbucks, smack bang in the middle of 'Overpriced Real Estate'. Am amazed I didn't have to pay $500 to sit at a table.

To be honest, the latte I ordered was pretty overpriced too, considering it tasted like several weeks old filter :-(
author: Caz R.

description: This is rare coming from me because usually I don't care. I drink coffee everyday. I recently moved into the area and multiple times I witness terrible employees with bad attitudes. Specifically ignoring me, acting like they don't care about anything at all. And being a Verismo customer, I replenish. You had a 30% off sale and only gave me $6 off of three $11.95 boxes............ 30% off 11.95 is not $6. I will not come back to this location.
author: Eric B.

description: Boy do I love my Starbucks. Usually lots of folks in here trying to look cool while pretending to read a magazine that they don't realize is being held upside down, or talking on their phone with the home screen display still showing. But hey its entertainment so whatevs. The baristas are cool and will make your drink faster than any other Starbucks.
author: Court S.

description: Ughhhhh Starbucks. The only thing I can tolerate about a Starbucks are the everything bagels and a black tea with strawberry syrup. I was craving the latter today so my boyfriend went here to grab me one. The cashier had no idea what he was requesting and literally scratched his head in confusion. He said they didn't have any syrup, which I found really hard to believe. The result was a nasty concoction of black tea, strawberry pulp and whatever else was in there. It's not a crazy request, I've ordered this drink at a few other locations and have never had difficulty. Anyhoo, it's Starbucks. There are so many better coffee shops to check out.
author: Jamie B.

description:
- No big comfy chairs like the marina location
- Its freezing in here
- The trash can is always full
- restroom was out of soap
- Not enough outlets!
author: William B.

description:
I never thought Starbucks could be a scene....but this one definitely is. On a sunny day the tables outside are prime real estate for people watching. I don't actually go here very often but whenever I do I think that it would be a great place to hang out with similar work at home young people who want to be a bit more social than to just stay at home. The starbucks itself is pretty small compared to the others but it has a fireplace which I think is very nice. 

As far as the drinks - same as every other starbucks in my opinion. That's the diea behind a chain, right?
author: Carlos A.

description:
I never write reviews. But I feel that I have been wronged by this Starbucks.  Like most of the others I miss the smiling faces that used to be at this location.  They knew you and always had a kind word to say. Not these new folks.  So I had bought a bag of coffee beans, the Xmas Blend, got it home and brewed it. For some reason the taste was to say the least industrial cleaner tasting.  Not sure what has happened, I buy beans here all the time. At this location. So I took the bag in to tell the employee to just exchange it and she said we don't take anything back that has been opened.  
Now I am furious I plan on calling the company because the beans are so bad that I am kind of afraid that maybe something was spilled on them. All I wanted to do was exchange them for another bag.  My husband is more than furious.
author: robbie t.

description: Got a bagel which was great, but man oh man were the guys working horrible. I was greeted with "what do you want." And a sour face. He then turned around to get my bagel and another even grumpier face walked up and put his hand out. I have him my card with a smile on my face. He swiped and started to walk away. I asked if it went through cause he hasn't said thank you or anything for that matter and didn't give me a receipt. The other guy then handed me my bagel and that was it. I received a total of 2 sentences. "What do you want." And "yes it went through" what a lovely bunch of men working there. Haha, I will be sure to turn right around the next time they are working.
author: Ashley W.

description: The people who work at this location are straight up punks.  I've had this experience with them time and time again.  Get a grip on reality guys, when you're at work act like it!  Take my $, pour the effing coffee and then hand it to me - how you manage to get this wrong, I have no idea.  If this sounds or comes across as rude maybe you should consider how I feel.
author: Ian L.

description: If I could give this Starbucks 0 stars, I would. The customer service here is seriously lacking. I just started a new job over in this neighborhood and I was so excited to see a Starbucks two blocks away. The very first time I went there the service was ok, but they were sort of busy so being that I work for Starbucks myself and I know how rushes can be, I gave them the benefit of the doubt. However every time I have been there after that has been a complete disappointment. I am always helped by the same rude guy who acts like putting on a smile is a crime. I have never been greeted with a "Hi" or "How are you" which is Starbucks standard, I always get a "what do you want" or "what are you having" in a disinterested tone. There have been multiple occasions where my drinks have been made incorrectly, and every time I call them out on it they act as if I am bothering them. This is the RUDEST, most UNPLEASANT staff I have ever seen at a Starbucks. I'm not even sure how they stay in business. I will be filing a complaint with their DM as well as corporate.
author: Ash A.

description: Waited almost 15 minutes for a spinach feta wrap. Told the girl who made it for me that I waited that long and got nothing but attitude back. Not an I'm sorry or anything. Oh well guess I'll have to start going to Peets next door. I still haven't learned my lesson about Starbucks. I'm giving it two stars because at least the wrap was good. It was a desperate attempt for food in this area because a lot of stuff doesn't open till 11.
author: Erik H.

description: Everytime i enter this Starbucks the same guy is always working and making drinks & he always look like he has a attitude. It's not my fault you decided to work at Starbucks. I ordered a Carmel Frapuccino with extra Carmel around the cup. He did not make it right!  so I asked the cashier if he can do my Frapuccino again, and the guy who was making the drinks seem as he had an attitude. This Starbucks does not know how to make there drinks at all I would not go back in here again. Usually when I go to a Starbucks everyone is mostly bubbly. This one everybody is dry and antisocial.
author: Leanna W.

description:
Friendly staff. 
Plenty of seats - indoors and outdoors.
Fake fireplace - adds to the cozy atmosphere
One bathroom - clean but not the cleanest I've seen. No key code necessary 
Plenty of people with mac books.
author: Sarah C.

description: I walk by this Starbucks location all of the time and finally went in at about 7 PM on a Thursday night. The barista at the register was very courteous and respectful and made sure to spell my name correctly. Just as I was about to leave, another barista came up to the table area I was sitting near and offered me and another woman next to me a cake cop. I accepted, and the woman next to me refused because of allergies. However, after she mentioned to me that that same barista seemed very attentive; he had given her more tea when she asked for hot water, etc. my first experience was pretty great customer service wise. I would return.
author: Janine N.

description:
Fine, I'll review it.

Even though I generally don't like to review Starbucks, since I used to work at one and I still pretty much go to one everyday, according to Yelp I'm a "regular" at this location and it keeps popping up as my "next review" so I figure I'll just go ahead and do it.

Well...umm...I don't really have much to say.  I come to this Starbucks occasionally on Saturdays when I leave the gym.  It's generally not that crowded, but maybe that's a different story during the week.  The baristas always seem nice and they make my drink right.  This is a pretty typical Starbucks and that's A-OK by me.
author: George A.

description: This was my old neighborhood Starbucks and seriously had the coolest team members. Most of them, unfortunately have recently left, since a new district manager took over, which hopefully someone at corporate will take notice of because they seriously had the best team there ever! The 5 stars is for them, not the current management...
author: Christina S.

description: So since I am the duke, I thought I should probably write a review for this Starbucks. The staff is pretty friendly, no problems with them. Except my experience can be a little wack sometimes. The food is modest good for if you want a a brownie or a lemon bar, not a full blown meal. Most pastries run from $1.50-3. The food taste like any other hipster loving coffee chain store. Except I wish they would be able to control the heat and air conditioner, when it's away to hot outside they crack up their conditioners to Arctic Pole weather, don't get me wrong if ur in Starbucks for more than an hour that is pretty frigid, same goes with their heater.  Also, sometimes I wish they would add more variety to their music choices, but eh I am not complaining. Tip when this place is super crowded best go somewhere else or comeback later
author: Brent L.

description: Classy, clean. Luxurious leather seating. Drinks as expected. Pleasant service.
author: Inigo M.

description: Went here on Sunday and service really sucked.  When someone orders a medium roast and you say we're out... it is probably a good idea to ask them, would you like blonde or dark?  not just put whatever in and snatch the money out of my hand. Highly rude staff that does not seem to be able to handle the rush.  Nowhere near as good as the one on Buchanan.
author: Alex A.

description: My neighborhood Starbucks.  As good as any, some outdoor seating, relatively small interior.  You will always get what you expect...
author: Andy S.

description: What a shame. This Russian Hill location used to be one that people came literally from all of the city to go to b/c of the superior customer experience. But since manager Jenn left, we've had 2 incompetents, Devon and now Mike, who don't care about the customers or their staff. Which is a shame: barristas like Jay, Joan, Carlos are terrific and, unlike their manager, always smile and remember your name and drink. But when you have a manager like Mike who bragged about getting out of working Xmas day & leaving it to his staff (nothing like leading by example, Mike), and who scolds the customers for not following "store rules", it makes you realize you might be happier at the Pete's up the block.
author: Richard B.

description:
The best thing about this Starbucks is the people watching and friendly staff. I've gone in multiple times and they didn't have a certain tea I wanted so they let me pick another one and gave it to me for free (both times).

The only downside to this Starbucks are the day-lurkers that hang out in the same seat for several hours occupying the majority of the inside real estate.
author: Jason M.

description:
I love this starbucks.  It's always crowded but they have a cute little fireplace in the middle that makes it homier than other more generic starbucks.

Here's why I really love this location. THE EMPLOYEES.

There is an elderly gentleman that comes in often.  He walks very slowly with the help of a cane.  He sits down and gets table service immediately with all his favorite things ready for him and all he has to do is hand them cash.  I've never seen such amazingly sweet service from a Starbucks.  This guy, who probably takes 7 minutes to labor his way down the block, gets to feel a part of the whole coffee shop morning bustle without having to stand in a long line or injure himself.  Really makes me smile
  
I've seen the staff do countless other thoughtful things and they remember my order.  I never thought I'd review a Starbucks but stop in at least for the fab employees.
author: kim k.

description: What I like about Starbuck's is that it is consistent, whether I'm at a Starbuck's in Tokyo or at a Starbuck's in Santa Cruz. That is, until I am at Starbuck's in Russian Hill. The barista's here always manage to make my drink incorrectly. This morning, I ordered a Grande Mocha and my drink did not have any whipped cream after I specifically asked for it. The same barista that made my Mocha this morning, had been consistenly making my drinks wrong the past five weeks. Once, I complained and said that my drink was supposed to be topped with toffee pieces and she rudely said, "No it doesn't, we have never had toffee." To which I replied, "Yes, I've had it before, why would I make this up." Then she said something like no sorry we don't have it and walked away. Then I asked if she could just put some other kind of topping on my drink to which she did, reluctantly. It would not have been so hard for her to apologize for not making my drink properly and offer an alternative to the toffee pieces instead of making me feel uncomfortable by asking her. I don't remember her name but she seriously lacks skills in customer service and skills in following directions and making drinks. Now I can see why there are so many negative/one star reviews for this location.
author: Ni N.

description:
We go to grab our coffee at Starbucks because we count on the consistency of fresh, strong coffee wherever we see this storefront. So, you can imagine our disappointment when we moved a few blocks away, and the coffee was the pits. We tried. Thought someone was maybe having an off day or something. But after 6 weeks of trying, we are not going back. 

Maybe they make great espresso or delicious frappuccinos. I have no idea. The coffee just sucks!! Not fresh, not strong enough. 

I hope I can update this review after the renovation with happy news of revitalized coffee brewing efforts. Will keep you posted.
author: Mary W.

description:
Are you really checking out the yelp review on a Starbucks?

Well, this one is like every other Starbucks. Average coffee, a lot of flavors to add to your espresso drink.
author: Andrew M.

description:
SERVICE:
Workers are friendly/nice here :) .. close early-ish tho at 8:30pm. free wifi.

ATMOSPHERE:
So small! Crowded with ppl working on their laptops! Lol. Few tables outside, in a nice street with restaurants, stores, pubs to walk to.
author: Angela L.

description:
New management!
 NOT SO NICE!  Lady needs some lessons on how to treat staff and customers.
All the good old friendly guys I have enjoyed for YEARS have left. No longer the smiling friendly corner it used to be.  Thank  god there is other alternatives on this street.
author: Tania S.

description:
I adore this Starbucks!  They should change it to Starbucks Supreme Edition because it so much better than the rest.

While I have been in between jobs and job searching all day, this has pretty much been my office.  Let me tell you why!

#1 - The staff!  They are all so friendly, funny and nice.  I enjoy chatting with them. 

#2 - Location.  It is blocks from my apartment, right next to a Walgreens and Real Foods store in case I need to grab anything mid-day.

#3 - Space.  Good amount of tables and there is seating inside and outside.

#4 - Prices.  Okay, it helps that I have a gold card but I get my grande coffee with SF hazelnut and soymilk for under 2 bucks. Plus free refills. Nice!

#5 - Community.  I have had so many interesting conversations with people here and some have even led to great friendships.

#6 - Free wi-fi. Yay!

In short, love this place and you should too!
author: Kate J.

description: This will actually be one of my most positive reviews ever. I am a starbucks nut, I drink a cup of coffee every day (literally I won't miss a day) and I have many options- I think there are about 7+ locations between my home and my office. Since I have the choice, it's the people, the speed, and the ambiance that makes the difference. At this specific location, the crew is super friendly and welcoming, they even remember my drink EVERY morning (seriously all of them, the week and the weekend crew). They genuinely want to know how my day is going and they are consistently friendly with A++ customer service. This team deserves to be recognized- thanks Starbucks on Polk! :)
author: Christine L.

description: Oh Nikki, Nikki, Nikki. Why do you have such a crappy attitude and disposition?!?  Nothing can ever be your fault. Just because I mention you gave me the wrong drink (quite politely by the way) and god forbid I actually want the $4 drink I ordered, you first accuse me of not correctly ordering the drink I've been ordering for 16 years. Then, you move on to being crappy to your co-workers, blaming them for marking the cup wrong. (This has happened at least 3 times over the last few months.) Perhaps it wouldn't happen if you would be a good barista and do a better job of training your newbies. Hint: obviously yelling at them after you treat your paying customers like they're bothering you doesn't work. You should be fired.
author: S C.

description:
This Starbucks always feels a bit cramped to me. Because it's centrally located on busy Polk Street, it could definitely use to be a bit bigger. I love the little outdoor tables though and the fireplace. Just don't head to this Starbucks if you get claustrophobic or plan to order your drink to go... 

A great recent Starbucks discovery: if you register your Starbucks gift card, you get free flavor shots in your coffee (love the sugar free varieties!) and soy milk. Enjoy!
author: Meghan P.

description:
This place rocks. I only come in maybe once or twice a week because I travel a lot for work. Somewhere around the third week I started coming here, the barista had recognized me and started getting my drink ready when I came in the door. I can't even begin to discuss how amazing I found this. He had never talked to me and I had only been in the shop a handful of times and yet he already knew me and my order. Over the next few months, I saw this happen a lot with other customers, too. It's just impressive to me that he has the capacity to remember that many different people and their orders and actually cares enough to do it. 

I find comfort in my Grande Nonfat Chai no matter where I have it (some I like more than others... even though they're working off a standard recipe, there is definitely variation across starbucks), but I continually make the effort now to come here because I really appreciate the extra effort from the staff here. They're very friendly and also very efficient. Even though they're friendly (and therefore will chat among each other and with the customers), they're still getting stuff done. As someone who stops in on my morning commute and therefore is on a schedule, I really appreciate that.

And on top of the great service, they make a darn good grande nonfat chai! :)
author: Kara B.

description:
Starbucks coffee is Starbucks coffee... not great. 

But I love this location because the baristas are awesome! They are very nice and friendly. There was one time that I ordered drip coffee and they were in the middle of brewing a fresh pot. They comped my drink because I had to wait a few minutes for the coffee to finish. Fresh coffee for free! 

The biggest downside is that it is always freezing inside! Bring a jacket!
author: Casey N.

description: They say they are open until 8 pm but they start to clean and put up table at 7. By 7:30 they ask people to leave. If you want to close at 7:30 then state that. Don't say you close at 8 pm and then kick people out at 7:30.
author: Bruce B.

description:
I visit this particular Starbucks about 2/week. I wanted to write a review to share my appreciation with how thoughtful and kind the staff at this Starbucks is. I have a Starbucks I frequent close to work and they know my name and all that- But do they scream with excitement when I walk in? No. Do they hug me when I tell them I am so sad? No. Thank you for making my day so much better.

I LOVE the staff. Michele (with one L) is the nicest, warmest person I have come across here in San Francisco. She suggests new drinks for me to try and always remembers me as Amanda Vanilla and my Boyfriend Murray Chocolate- because those are our flavors of drinks we usually get.

Love. I can't wait til morning because now I would like a coffee.

THANK YOU!

P.S the woman with the short pixie hair and bangs I liked that you were so smiley today.
author: Amanda F.

description:
Sorry to say, I love Starbucks. As stated on previous reviews, I go for two things and order them the same way, extra hot, no whip, no foam. For some reason this property can't get the drift of no foam. I get 25% foam all the time. I have let the Baristas know of this issue and everyone had excuses why it comes out with lots of foam.
Hummmmm, then why is it only this location? 
I'll walk up to California and get my moneys worth of product.
author: Geoff F.

description: Nikki is always friendly and professional. I enjoy going to this Starbucks location because I look forward to her excellent customer service. Starbucks is lucky to have her working for them. She makes an excellent Mocha, too!
author: Eli S.

description: I'm fed up. The lines are getting ridiculous at Starbucks. The problem is not the lines it's the employees that lack the urgency, training and/or desire to serve coffee with a smile and in a timely fashion.
author: Joe M.

description:
I love SB....and go twice a day.  I spend every weekend in SF & walk to the SB on Polk street.  I can remember how great the staff USE to be at SB, but now the service varies quite a bit.  I can't tolerate poor customer service.  You walk into this SB on Polk street & you don't even get a hello or a smile or a Thank you.  One time I had a discussion with the casier who charged me for a Latta when I ordered a Streamer.  She didn't know there was a separate charge for a Soy Streamer as oppose to a Latta.  She charged me for a soy Latta & not for a Soy Streamer.  

I think SB or the store managers need to 'beef up' their customer service.  They hire all these young adults who have big time attitudes & know very little about customer service. 

Pete's is right next door....maybe they have better service!
author: Kendall R.

description:
I work two blocks from this Starbucks. Been going here for four years now! WOW, that's kinda ridiculous...
They know me by name and my normal drink of choice. 
Everyone here is super nice and helpful!
They are speedy, because I run down when I get a 5 minute break, and I can always count on getting back to work in time. 
Thanks guys! You all rock!
author: Kelly T.

description:
This mornings walk to Starbucks was dangerous...

You'd think, what little things I'd have to worry about walking one block to my Russian Hill Starbucks... Well, I almost got run over by a bicycle as I was crossing the street. There was a car at the stop sign, I waited for him to proceed. Then I step into the street took two steps and swoop, the bike sets me back to the curb. He went by too fast for me to knock him over or yell at him. But one inch further in the cross walk would have made for some bumps and bruises not only that, but have dirtied my pressed tan slacks that I just got back from the cleaners. Oh, mister bike man... I will remember your face, as for it was only 5 inches from mine.  

After my heart stopped racing, I eventually made it through the front door of the Starbucks and it was crowded with  no place to sit or stand to wait for my coffee. A little annoyed, but I got over it quickly for I had my raspberry mocha in my hand shortly and was on my way to work. 

Honestly, i only make it to Starbucks if I have a gift card to spend.  Otherwise I go to Pete's only a couple doors down. It may be because I have overdosed on Starbucks or their coffee isn't as good, but I am truly on a Pete's kick.
author: Dee C.

description:
Reasons to choose Starbucks over It's a Grind, Teavana, Peet's, Royal Ground no. 1, Royal Ground no. 2, Loving Cup, La Boulange, or Bob's, which are all reasonably close:

1. The bathrooms are unlocked (or possibly I always arrive at very opportune times)
2. They have a handicap accessible table
3. They serve Starbucks drinks
4. Maybe you happen to live across the street
5. You want to go someplace you can use your credit card easily and guilt-free

I don't have great experiences with the baristas here. They are anti-eye contact. Then again, as I mentioned it's a great place to pee.
author: Jena E.

description: Please stop closing so damn early on Sundays and making me walk all the way to Union and Laguna to get my freakin' Americano!
author: Suany W.

description: On the corner with 2 big windows for prime people watching. Tables inside and outside, good for studying. Fireplace in the middle. Decently consistent drinks although the last two times they forgot to give me nonfat milk. Nice and cozy.
author: Allie E.

description:
While I love Starbucks, and the people are friendly, there is a LOT of noise pollution. I know i'm not in a library, but it feels like it. Everyone is on their laptops or reading. They have dropped trays from the over TWICE. Im sitting near the kitchen so it is especially loud. The people working are talking to each other so loudly, that I keep breaking concentration. It is obnoxious in here! I would leave, but I have too many dang things with me. 

Please, Starbucks, PIPE DOWN. This is my first time studying here, and I dont think I'll come back to this one.
author: Lady L.

description:
They have cupcakes now!!  vanilla something something...
YUM.  It has white sweet cream with yellow and white sprinles on top.  I love these sprinkles.

They had a choco cupcake too with shaved choco on top.
author: Wakako U.

description:
Sometimes I think people are offended when I walk into Starbucks on Polk with my La Boulange coffee in hand.

Although I don't care for the coffee at Starbucks, I have 3 words: Petite Vanilla Scones.

I haven't had a huge appetite lately, and yet, these are the only things that manage to sound good in the morning. They taste like vanilla bean heaven. Little bites of sweet heaven.
author: Laura D.

description: My favorite Starbucks anywhere!  Jen, Victor, John, Vern, Angie, etc. all offer exceptional service, the right drink made the right way and fast friendly service.    What more could anyone ask for?
author: S W.

description: Unbelievable incompetence!  Coffee is consistent and terrific as always but it's a challenge to obtain a cup through the staff at this location.
author: Joe S.

description:
I know; it's just a Starbucks. But this neighborhood rendition of the chain makes you forget how huge and heartless the corporation can be.

Baristas routinely remember customers names and orders, and make small talk as drinks are being made. The shop is always clean, and there is a usually a very good chance of finding a seat or place to do some work around the in-store fireplace (which is never on.)
author: chris g.

description:
This place gets 1 star for having wifi.   As with all starbucks, the coffee tastes like garbage and its overpriced.  Yum, can i have some more burnt coffee with whipped cream and caramel and chocolate syrup and nuts and sprinkles served at 178.3 degrees?   Yea! Thats what coffee is all about!   
Go to Peet's, get good coffee, then have a seat in SB and do some work.  Make sure they see you drinking Peets, that is key to the plan.   Wearing a Peet's tshirt gets bonus points.
author: Dan G.

description:
I like chains, I admit it.  I like them because they are supposed to be consistent, you know what you know what you are going to get here.  With that said though, various locations do vary in their ambiance and vibe.

I liked this Starbucks at Russian Hill because it had outdoor seating which was great for people watching, and the street was busy enough for you to be quite entertained.  Inside was typical Starbucks but the people hanging out were professionals or housewives it appeared.  In addition there was a cozy fireplace set up too which was nice, though not of interest to me on a sunny day like today.  

What makes this Starbucks better than other locations is the clientele that frequents here and the people watching.  Other than you know what to expect coming in here........... And personally, I love Starbucks so you won't see me complaining about my Frappachino.
author: Denise B.

description:
You have the comfort of a chain here (although I've noticed that people in SF dislike chains...) What I mean is that, you always know what you are getting. What you cannot rely on is the quality of service. 

I have had almost all good, even great, experiences here (one time they even gave me a free frappucino!), but I have on occasion ran into the girl who acts as if my being there is really putting her out. Personally, I really don't care, but I know how this can get some others' panties in a twist.

My favorite favorite drink is the Cinnamon Dolce Latte. You can order it "light" now, and even get it as a frap. Last Wednesday I went there around 9am, ordered a venti CD Latte, sat down at a table by the window and read my book.  About a half hour later I notice the man (picture a midage, balding man wearing sweatpants and a tshirt) getting excited. I try not to look but I can see him out of the corner of my eye. 

Finally I look away from my book and glance around the store.. thats when I see Gavin Newsom. I'm still puzzled and continue to look to see if possibly God had stopped in for a latte, but no. The man across from me is about to pee his pants over Gavin. ARE YOU KIDDING ME!?... 

Anyway. Long story ... long... If it's good enough for Gavin.. well frankly, why do you care?
author: Valerie W.

description:
This Starbucks has been a regular stop for many many a Saturday and Sunday afternoon, and I'll have to say I've been growing less and less impressed. Howard Schultz envisioned a world of 40,000 Starbucks. This particular location causes me to envision a world of 160,000 baristas standing around chatting while the other 40,000 struggle to take orders, run the line and make coffee all at the same time. 

And if you frequent this location, you will still get  your standard Starbucks coffee with a smile. And it will be fine, as long as you don't ask for something mind-numbingly difficult (like no foam - that's a total stumper). But you might stand around in exasperation wondering how it could possibly take 8 minutes to make your drink when you are the only ordering customer while it takes your usual Starbucks by the office about 30 seconds to make the same drink even with a huge line out the door.

I expect this sort of service from the Starbucks at the Metreon, or the airport, but not in Russian Hill. It's not bad per say, it's just not particularly good. And there's a Peet's next door and a Teavana across the street...
author: Ben R.

description:
Staring at my (well-worn) Starbucks gold card, I realize that I spend enough of my life in this establishment that the differences between individual locations make a big impact on my experience (and work efficiency).  Time to start reviewing them, here goes the first.

Features:

1. Tables - ample. 7 outdoors (though I've never been here when it's warm enough to sit outside, thanx sf weather :P) , 9 indoors + 1 mini table (btwn stuffed chairs).

2. Fireplace - yes! Not always on, however, even when raining/cold.

3. Outlets - plenty, and well-placed within table-reach.

4. Other furniture - 2 sofa chairs. 

5. Other - 2 walls are windows, so great view of outside. Lots of day lighting :)

6. Parking - metered street parking, limit 1 hour.  Can be hard to park.
author: Quince P.

description: Typical Starbucks with an excellent location for people watching on Polk Street.
author: Ryan M.

description: I don't drink coffee... but LOVE Starbucks chai lattes. I like this large Starbucks on the corner of Polk. So much of the store is devoted to arm chairs, sofas, and tables. There's a mini-fireplace in the middle. Great place to work on a laptop and watch the passers by.
author: Margot G.

description: I'm at this Starbucks at least once a week when I'm working from home. I usually always find a place to sit, the staff has always been extremely kind, and my (simple) drink orders have always been made to perfection. I sit in this Starbucks for hours and get work done, and no one seems to mind that I'm there for so long. Oh, and free wifi... what more does one need for a coffee shop?
author: Ashley D.

description:
Short lines, friendly service. And of course you know the coffee will be like every other Starbucks. Starbucks is definitely my favorite place for my drink with far too many adjectives: grande decaf vanilla soy latte. I almost hate myself for needing so many words to describe my drink. It is delicious though.

It is usually pretty crowded but for some reason the table by the fireplace is almost never taken. I'd come here more often if it were open later.
author: Stu M.

description: As far as coffee goes, Starbucks is not the best, and we all know it. What makes Starbucks worth the trip are the fantastic baristas. This location simply has the best baristas, hands down. If you want to be warmly welcomed this is the place to be. The morning crew (Jenn, Lenny, and John) are absolutely amazing. And the evening kids are pretty fantasctic too, very laid back and willing to chat (Justin, George, and Luis). And Jessica makes some mean soy foam, fyi ;)
author: Jessica S.

description: This place is as good as it gets. If you become a regular, they know exactly what you want when you walk in. I have my coffee ready for me before I can even pay. Every single employee there is very friendly and are on top of things. Place is a hidden gem if you ask me! Keep up the good work!
author: Joshua s.

description: Oh, vanilla sunshine cupcake.  My stomach felt like poop and I needed a coffee, but it was you who did the infinite good to my delicate psyche.  Your fluffy white and yellow exterior and daisy accoutrement looked like I wanted to feel, and you were good to the last finger-lickin' drop.  I would sell my soul to Starbucks for another afternoon with you like this.
author: Tanya N.

description: Six pump venti soy no-water chai.  That alone is worth five stars.  BUT the coffee is definitely nothing compared to Peet's which is practically next door.
author: Amme P.

description:
I wasn't going to review starbucks because really, how many people check Yelp before choosing a mainstream coffee shop? But reading these other reviews, I thought I needed to add my two sense since this location is not getting it's due worth., 

Yes it's "small" but very cozy. There are oversized leather chairs behind the fireplace which make that my number 1 spot to scout out when I enter the coffee shop. I personally would prefer a small location though compared to a large one for the more quaint feel; especially since Russian HIll has that cozy, neighborhood feel. There are also chairs and tables outside but lately it's been too cold to sit out there. I imagine they are quite nice though on a warm day. The baristas are all super nice and most of them have remembered every drink from the regulars. Sometimes I sit there, in my oversized leather chair, and marvel at how few people actually have to say the order. That's the greatest thing about this location; they remember your name and drink after just a few visits and are genuinely social people and fun to have a casual chat with in the morning. 

To some of the other negative reviews about this location, FYI, in the over a year I have been frequenting this location, there has never been a girl with dreads working there. And everytime I have had a problem with a drink, (im very pickY) they have always fixed it and returned it PERFECTLY. So unless you're a complete jerk of a customer, I don't see anyone in that store being rude. Especially this mystery girl with dreads who actually doesn't exist...Also, there are 2 "local homeless people" that do hang out around Starbucks but 1) if you're afraid of the everyday homeless man on the corner then maybe you should move out of SF and 2) there is another one that stands outside The Bagelry/Peets selling newspapers so it's not like they are exclusive to Starbucks :)

Can you tell I love starbucks?
author: Sarah I.

description: The place is clean enough here but the bathroom is atrocious. I really expect better from a bathroom in posh Russian Hill. So gross it makes me question the cleanliness of their coffee.
author: Cathy T.

description: There are 56 Starbucks within a 2 mile radius of me. They are are just marginal, as far as coffee goes. There are three reasons why I like this one better than most. First, GREAT people watching, if you can get a seat. Second, they have this convection oven/microwave type thing (not every Starbucks has one) to heat their pastries, which makes their marginal pastries taste much better. Third, I HATE lukewarm coffee, which I find in most Starbucks.  At this one they actually make their coffee hot, so that sleeve they give you actually serves some sort of purpose. Other than that, the coffee is the same as every other Starbucks everywhere. Its the little things that make the difference.
author: All About Town ..

description: I  heart my new SBX! Outside seating, a couple comfy chairs inside, and tons of hot passers-by! Yay for my new hood :)
author: Madeleine K.

description: What is so special about this generic chain at the polk street location? It is the best people watching spot in russian hill - that is if you can grab an outdoor table. I order coffee here not because its good - we all know starbucks could care less about putting out quality coffee when their real enterprise are those overpriced frapps and lattes - but because I want to use their tables. Oh the long hung over conversations I have had in front of this starbucks, wasting away hours just watching dogs (why are there so many?), babies (again - why are there so many?), and folk in sunglasses. My San Francisco experience wouldn't be the same without this staple down the street.
author: Stacy H.

description: I'm a HUGE Starbucks fan, and this specific shop on Polk street is my favorite. they are quick with their service, everybody is super nice, and they make my coffee just the way I like it!
author: emma s.

description: This is not my favorite Starbucks. They seem to be slightly slower and less competent here. Maybe it is because I am used to the downtown location where there is an understanding that incredibly swift service (smile included) is not only necessary but quite possibly the highlight of many people's day.  That last minute of freedom (and the first sweet moment of caffeination) before the reality of the work day sets in. (On a side note, I just discovered that caffeination is not actually a word. But decaffeination is. Hmm.) But here on Polk, the laid back attitude that is so wonderful mid-afternoon on a Saturday makes less sense to me during the morning rush.
author: julia r.

description:
I call this Starbucks "the office."  Because it's a Starbucks, I should give it 3 stars on principle.  However, I love the kids who work there too damn much to do that to them.  The sign of a good coffee shop is when they remember your drink after only a few visits.  Those guys remembered my Venti Earl Grey order on the third time ordering!  (Unfortunately for them I like to keep people on their toes and that day I ordered something else... But it's the thought that counts!)

To my non-alcoholic Cheers (where they might not know my name, but they probably have an idea of what I'm hankering for)!
author: Liesl B.

description: God, it's a good thing that Starbucks has gone back to its roots to attempt to make a good cup of joe, too bad it sucks. Pike Place Blend? I am sure that the inmates at San Quentin wouldn't mind the Starbucks experience, but if you have to pay $2 for a grande drip that tastes like Folgers original I don't even want to know what a $5 frappachino (milkshake) tastes like. Seriously, the people that work here are cool, I like the indoor fireplace, and it's good people watching, but if you want good coffee, you are in the wrong place. Howie, seriously buddy, cash in some more stock options, even though your stock is down 44% from its year ago highs, but who cares, you can backdate them, and find a columbian bean farmer like Juan Valdez's rich cousin or something and tell him that you want to serve good coffee. Who knows, you may even be able to make the world a better place using sustainable farming practices. I just want a decent cup of coffee.
author: Miles T.

description: No longer my Starbucks of choice. I enjoyed this location because it was like none other, and now they've made this location seem like every Starbucks I walk into. In your face, correcting your coffee terminology, and slow service. I might as well go back to the Starbucks that's a block from my house, rather than walking a mile to get to this one.
author: V T.

description: This starbucks has an odd smell inside.  I'd say about 50% of Starbucks locations do.  The drinks taste fine, though.
author: Matt M.

description: one thing i forgot to mention is that my soy vanilla latte NEVER tastes right! but i still will come here near daily for the aforementioned reasons...
author: Danielle J.
